p: TGEV and PEDV have been reportedly co-circulating in Eurasia and the USA. Recently in Europe, a pathogenic recombinant TGEV/PEDV variant (swine enteric coronavirus, SeCoV) was recognised and described (Akimkin et al. 2016; Belsham et al. 2016; Boniotti et al. 2016). SeCoV that contains PEDV S protein on a TGEV backbone apparently leads to disease clinically indistinct from the TGEV- and PEDV-produced ones (Table 4.1). Additionally, a novel bat-HKU2-like porcine coronavirus [porcine enteric alphacoronavirus (PEAV), GDS04 strain] associated with severe diarrheal disease in suckling piglets was identified in Southern China in 2017 (Gong et al. 2017) (Table 4.1). However, its prevalence and adaptation status to the swine host are unknown.
